newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish paper exports through ports up in Oct.
newsitem.headline: Finnish paper exports through ports up in Oct.

text.p: Finnish paper exports through ports turned in a year-on-year rise in October, the Board of Navigation said in its monthly report released on Friday.
Exports of paper through ports increased 19.6 percent compared to October last year to 785,000 tonnes, it said.
Until October, paper exports through ports had fallen every month since August 1995, a board of navigation official said by telephone.
Despite the rise in October, paper exports through ports were 10.4 percent lower year-on-year in January-October at 6.61 million tonnes, it said.
Overall exports through ports increased 17.8 percent year-on-year in October to 3.18 million tonnes, while in January-October, overall exports through ports fell 4.4 percent to 27.46 million tonnes.
Imports through ports increased 11.0 percent in October to 3.85 million tonnes, while the January-October total was 0.4 percent lower at 30.16 million tonnes.
